Package com.linkedin.venice.pubsub.manager

Class TopicManager

java.lang.Object
com.linkedin.venice.pubsub.manager.TopicManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class TopicManager extends Object implements Closeable
Topic manager is responsible for creating, deleting, and updating topics. It also provides APIs to query topic metadata. It is essentially a wrapper over PubSubAdminAdapter and PubSubConsumerAdapter with additional features such as caching, metrics, and retry. TODO: We still have retries in the PubSubAdminAdapter, we will eventually move them here.

    • createTopic

      public void createTopic(PubSubTopic topicName, int numPartitions, int replication, boolean eternal)
      Create a topic, and block until the topic is created, with a default timeout of 30000, after which this function will throw a VeniceException.

    • createTopic

      public void createTopic(PubSubTopic topicName, int numPartitions, int replication, boolean eternal, boolean logCompaction, Optional<Integer> minIsr)

    • createTopic

      public void createTopic(PubSubTopic topicName, int numPartitions, int replication, boolean eternal, boolean logCompaction, Optional<Integer> minIsr, boolean useFastPubSubOperationTimeout)
      Create a topic, and block until the topic is created, with a default timeout of 30000, after which this function will throw a VeniceException.
      Parameters:
      topicName - Name for the new topic
      numPartitions - number of partitions
      replication - replication factor
      eternal - if true, the topic will have "infinite" (~250 mil years) retention if false, its retention will be set to PubSubConstants.DEFAULT_TOPIC_RETENTION_POLICY_MS by default
      logCompaction - whether to enable log compaction on the topic
      minIsr - if present, will apply the specified min.isr to this topic, if absent, PubSub cluster defaults will be used
      useFastPubSubOperationTimeout - if false, normal PubSub operation timeout will be used, if true, a much shorter timeout will be used to make topic creation non-blocking.

    • createTopic

      public void createTopic(PubSubTopic topicName, int numPartitions, int replication, long retentionTimeMs, boolean logCompaction, Optional<Integer> minIsr, boolean useFastPubSubOperationTimeout)
      Create a topic, and block until the topic is created, with a default timeout of 30000, after which this function will throw a VeniceException.
      Parameters:
      topicName - Name for the new topic
      numPartitions - number of partitions
      replication - replication factor
      retentionTimeMs - Retention time, in ms, for the topic
      logCompaction - whether to enable log compaction on the topic
      minIsr - if present, will apply the specified min.isr to this topic, if absent, PubSub cluster defaults will be used
      useFastPubSubOperationTimeout - if false, normal PubSub operation timeout will be used, if true, a much shorter timeout will be used to make topic creation non-blocking.

    • updateTopicRetention

      public boolean updateTopicRetention(PubSubTopic topicName, long retentionInMS) throws PubSubTopicDoesNotExistException
      Update retention for the given topic. If the topic doesn't exist, this operation will throw PubSubTopicDoesNotExistException
      Parameters:
      topicName -
      retentionInMS -
      Returns:
      true if the retention time config of the input topic gets updated; return false if nothing gets updated
      Throws:
      PubSubTopicDoesNotExistException

      Parameters:
      topicName -
      expectedRetentionInMs -
      pubSubTopicConfiguration -
      Returns:
      true if the retention time gets updated; false if no update is needed.
      Throws:

      expectedLogCompacted -
      minLogCompactionLagMs - the overrode min log compaction lag. If this is specified and a valid number (> 0), it will override the default config

    • containsTopicAndAllPartitionsAreOnline

      public boolean containsTopicAndAllPartitionsAreOnline(PubSubTopic topic, Integer expectedPartitionCount)
      This is an extensive check to mitigate an edge-case where a topic is not yet created in all the brokers.
      Returns:
      true if the topic exists and all its partitions have at least one in-sync replica false if the topic does not exist at all or if it exists but isn't completely available

    • getEndPositionsForTopicWithRetries

      public Map<PubSubTopicPartition,PubSubPosition> getEndPositionsForTopicWithRetries(PubSubTopic pubSubTopic)
      Retrieves the latest (end) positions for all partitions of the specified topic.

      The returned offset represents the position of the next message that would be produced, which is effectively one greater than the offset of the last available message.

      Parameters:
      pubSubTopic - the topic for which to retrieve latest offsets
      Returns:
      a map containing partition numbers mapped to their corresponding latest offsets

    • getStartPositionsForTopicWithRetries

      public Map<PubSubTopicPartition,PubSubPosition> getStartPositionsForTopicWithRetries(PubSubTopic pubSubTopic)

    • getNumRecordsInPartition

      public long getNumRecordsInPartition(PubSubTopicPartition pubSubTopicPartition)
      Returns the total number of records currently available in the given topic-partition.

      This counts from PubSubSymbolicPosition.EARLIEST up to the latest available position.

      Parameters:
      pubSubTopicPartition - the topic-partition
      Returns:
      the number of records in the partition

    • countRecordsUntil

      public long countRecordsUntil(PubSubTopicPartition pubSubTopicPartition, PubSubPosition endPosition)
      Returns the number of records in the given topic-partition from the earliest available position up to the specified end position.

      Semantics follow diffPosition(start, end) of the underlying fetcher. In most implementations, endPosition represents "last + 1", so the count is effectively from EARLIEST inclusive to endPosition exclusive.

      Parameters:
      pubSubTopicPartition - the topic-partition
      endPosition - the position up to which records are counted
      Returns:
      the number of records from EARLIEST to endPosition

    • getIngestionProgressPercentage

      public int getIngestionProgressPercentage(PubSubTopicPartition topicPartition, PubSubPosition position)
      Indicates ingestion progress by returning the percentage of records in the given topic-partition up to the specified position.
      Parameters:
      position - the position up to which records are counted
      Returns:
      the percentage of records up to the specified position (0-100)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the number of partitions for the given topic
      Throws:

    • resolvePosition

      public PubSubPosition resolvePosition(PubSubTopicPartition partition, int positionTypeId, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Resolves a PubSubPosition from the given serialized buffer using the specified position type ID. This API is part of the Topic Manager (TM) interface because TM has access to a consumer instance capable of performing lookups from PubSubTopicPartition to PubSub-specific objects (e.g., Shard in LinkedIn's Xinfra clients), which may be required by some PubSub client implementations.
      Parameters:
      partition - The topic-partition context.
      positionTypeId - The type ID used to identify how to deserialize the position.
      buffer - The serialized form of the position.
      Returns:
      The resolved PubSubPosition.

    • diffPosition

      public long diffPosition(PubSubTopicPartition partition, PubSubPosition position1, PubSubPosition position2)
      Computes the difference between two positions within a given topic-partition. This API is part of the Topic Manager (TM) interface because TM has access to a consumer instance capable of performing lookups from PubSubTopicPartition to PubSub-specific objects (e.g., Shard in LinkedIn's Xinfra clients), which may be required by some PubSub client implementations.
      Parameters:
      partition - The topic-partition context.
      position1 - The first position.
      position2 - The second position.
      Returns:
      The difference between the two positions, in number of records.

    • comparePosition

      public long comparePosition(PubSubTopicPartition partition, PubSubPosition position1, PubSubPosition position2)
      Compares two positions within the context of a specific topic-partition. This API is part of the Topic Manager (TM) interface because TM has access to a consumer instance capable of performing lookups from PubSubTopicPartition to PubSub-specific objects (e.g., Shard in LinkedIn's Xinfra clients), which may be required by some PubSub client implementations.
      Parameters:
      partition - The topic-partition context.
      position1 - The first position.
      position2 - The second position.
      Returns:
      A negative number if position1 < position2, 0 if equal, and a positive number if position1 > position2.

    • advancePosition

      public PubSubPosition advancePosition(PubSubTopicPartition tp, PubSubPosition startInclusive, long n)
      Advances a position within a PubSubTopicPartition by a specified number of records.

      Currently, this method always returns an ApacheKafkaOffsetPosition constructed by incrementing the numeric offset in startInclusive by n. In the future, this will be replaced with a call to the underlying PubSubClient so that each implementation can return its own PubSubPosition type.

      Parameters:
      tp - the topic partition in which the position is being advanced; must not be null
      startInclusive - the starting position (inclusive) from which advancement begins; must not be null
      n - the number of records to advance; must be non-negative
      Returns:
      a new PubSubPosition representing the position n records after startInclusive
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative
      NullPointerException - if tp or startInclusive is null

    • getTopicRepository

      public PubSubTopicRepository getTopicRepository()
